Package serverside.clienthandler

Class ClientHandlerMethod

  • java.lang.Object
    • serverside.clienthandler.ClientHandlerMethod
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, ClientHandler
    public class ClientHandlerMethod
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClientHandler, java.lang.Runnable
    The client handler responsible for handling the messages sent by the client and sending messages to the client when not in a game of Pentago but connected to the Server. Whenever a client connects to the server a new clientHandler object is created for the client. Once a game has started the GameHandler then handles the messages until the game is over.

      The constructor for the client handler which creates a new clientHandler object with the passed parameters.

        Parameters:

        gs - - The game server it is going to connect to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the inputStreamReader cannot read in case connection with the server cannot be established

      • close

        public void close()
        This method used to exit and stop the client handler. It closes all the readers and writers and also closes the socket used by the client handler to end the connection with the server.
        Specified by:
        close in interface ClientHandler

      • run

        public void run()
        The clientHandler class is a runnable class and whenever a new thread of the ClientHandler class is started , the code below is executed by a thread. This code processes the incoming data from the client and sends the data from the server to the client as well depending on the message received by the client.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
